newsitem.title: USA: Benihana says sets holder rights plan.
newsitem.headline: Benihana says sets holder rights plan.

text.p: Benihana Inc, the restaurant chain, said Wednesday it has adopted a shareholder rights plan and has declared a dividend of one preferred share purchase right for each common share held.
The rights apply to shares held as of February 26 and for each share issued thereafter, it said.

The rights would be triggered if a person or group acquired 20 percent or more of the company's outstanding stock. The rights would be distributed 10 days following acquisition of the stake by such person or group.
Each right entitles a holder to buy from Benihana one 1/100th of a share of junior preferred stock for $24 for each right, subject to adjustment.
Benihana president Joel Schwartz said the rights plan seeks to protect shareholders from "inadequate acquisition proposals or proposals which are structured in a coercive manner."
